item.title: Using your phone to pay is convenient, but it can also mean you spend more
item.description: Consumers tend to spend about 10% more when they adopt mobile contactless payment methods, according to research from Assistant Professor Yuqian Xu at UNC-Chapel Hill.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: How people across the U.S. are making the most of the solar eclipse
item.description: NPR asked listeners to share what they're doing for the eclipse. Here are some memorable answers, from the new parents planning a themed baby shower to the mayor waving tourists off his small city.

item.title: Pro-Russia candidate Peter Pellegrini elected Slovakia president
item.description: A close ally of populist Prime Minister Robert Fico beat a pro-Western career diplomat to become Slovakia's new president, and succeed Zuzana Čaputová, the country's first female head of state.
item.content:encoded:
A close ally of populist Prime Minister Robert Fico beat a pro-Western career diplomat to become Slovakia's new president, and succeed Zuzana Čaputová, the country's first female head of state.

item.title: Bill Clinton and other leaders join Rwandans in marking 30 years since their genocide
item.description: Rwandans are commemorating 30 years since the genocide in which an estimated 800,000 people were killed by government-backed extremists, shattering the small East African country.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Yes, Biden is really running in November. But a lot of voters say they doubt it
item.description: Some people feel he's too old. Others think there's a plan afoot to swap in a more popular Democrat. There's a swirl of reasons why some people don't accept that Biden will be on the ballot this year.

item.description: A Powerball player has won a $1.3 billion jackpot, ending a winless streak that had stretched more than three months.

item.title: Iowa-UConn women's Final Four game is the most-watched hoops game in ESPN history
item.description: Friday's semifinal averaged 14.2 million viewers, making it the most-viewed women's basketball game on record and the largest audience for an ESPN basketball broadcast.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Authorities investigate suspected arson at Sen. Bernie Sanders' Vermont office
item.description: Burlington police say a male suspect set a door on fire Friday morning, trapping people inside and damaging the building. No injuries were reported, and Sanders wasn't in the state at the time.
